paragraphs.text: Zero suicides is an admirable aim but it requires all-out change.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: On Monday, Nick Clegg pledged to sign up the NHS to a national "zero suicide" campaign
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: This comes in a week when I have spent a lot of time talking to the media about depression in an attempt to get people to support Calm and the other charities that are doing incredible work to help people coping with mental illness
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I have appeared on national radio, in the press and on television to talk about my story
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the more coverage I get, the more I ask: why me?
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Let me make this clear
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I am not famous
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I am not trying to be famous
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I am a normal lad
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who made mistakes, lived a lie, and eventually attempted to take my own life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I am just another statistic
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Someone who suffered from an illness that took over my life and made me a person I didn't recognise
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: There is absolutely nothing special or unique about me
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yet I am getting calls from people asking me to share my story
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The fact that I am newsworthy, simply because I have spoken openly about the demons I was facing, makes me think that we are being greatly let down by society
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Suicide is the biggest single killer of men aged 20-49 in the UK
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: It's a statistic that, no matter how many times I say it, continues to shock me to the core
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yet it's something that few people seem to be talking about openly, if at all
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I get it, we're British
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sometimes we don't like talking about things that make us uncomfortable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sometimes we'd rather not ask the question because we can't handle the answer
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But that simply cannot continue
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's time that people are made to stand up and face the harsh reality
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The fear of being judged is preventing people from talking about their secret turmoil
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is very little being done by the people who have the biggest influence to remove those fears, remove the stigmas, to get people talking about mental health, and make people comfortable with the subject
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The media doesn't just have influence, it has a responsibility to help communicate a message and set an agenda
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yes, things are changing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it can't be right that the furthest we've come is having someone receive live therapy on air with Phillip Schofield or a soap character crashing a minibus
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is too much box-ticking going on
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A petition signed, a campaign joined, an empty promise in an election year
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: All very good but what do they actually do?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Do they help save enough lives?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The system needs changing from top to bottom
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is no consistency or urgency, despite the high rate of men dying from suicide
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What bigger wake-up call do you need?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I would ask David Cameron to speak up and tell us what he is going to do
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: To meet me, to let me introduce him to the small team at Calm, the volunteers, the campaigners, the people on the end of phones with someone's life in their hands
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Let me show him people who feel as if they have nowhere to turn
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Let me show him the lack of knowledge of some people working in GP surgeries, and the pressure that those who make a positive difference are working under, as rates of mental illness increase continually
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Let me show how so little can make such a big difference
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If Nick Clegg is serious about mental health then he needs to show it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's great that he has decided that we need to aim for zero suicides
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I wonder, what was the aim before this?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Just a few suicides?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A hundred?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Shouldn't the aim always have been zero?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The likes of Calm, Mind, The Samaritans and everyone else, are doing incredible work
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it shouldn't be left to them to do it all alone
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They can only work with the limited resources they have
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: They need supporting and backing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We need to put faces and voices to genuine experiences
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Speaking out about dealing with depression shouldn't be considered a "brave" act
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it shouldn't be an extraordinary or unusual story to read
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It should be common
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It should be accepted
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: It should be normal
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: while we live in a society that doesn't know how to deal with it, and perhaps does not want to deal with it, we cannot expect people to talk openly about such private matters
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Much focus is placed on those who are suffering
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and rightly so
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: in order to truly help them, we need to make everyone else comfortable and knowledgeable enough to know what to do, how to act, and know how to signpost people to the help that is out there
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We need to be talking about mental illness in schools
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We need to make in-depth training compulsory in the workplace
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We need to be training taxi drivers, bar staff, hairdressers - people who will find out more about a person through a casual conversation than their friends will ever know
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We need to normalise talking about the realities of depression, to normalise conversations about the very real prospect of suicide
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it is the only way we can move forward together
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We need a radical change from top to bottom
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Therapy isn't just about lying on a couch while someone writes down your childhood memories
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's about feeling comfortable enough to say you're not OK
paragraphs.label: assumption
